definition: (archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms

sentences.english: Now in front of us we can see Comrade Liu Shaoqi's former residence.
sentences.chinese: 大家現在看到的是劉少奇同志舊居。

sentences.english: You can have a peek at Mandela's house -- now a museum.
sentences.chinese: 曼德拉舊居現已成爲一座博物館。

sentences.english: The entrance of Shen Junru's old house and the wooden stairs.
sentences.chinese: 沈鈞儒舊居入戶門及舊居內的木質樓梯。

sentences.english: The entrance of Shen Junru's old house and the wooden stairs.
sentences.chinese: 沈鈞儒舊居入戶門及舊居內的木質樓梯。

definition: Lantian county in Xi'an 西安[Xi1 an1], Shaanxi
dangerous housing/building that is about to collapse
a scholar or government official living in one's village/a village gentleman/squire
honorific title for Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石[Jiang3 Jie4 shi2]
Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
